_header: Most reverend righteous regent of this regality
Subjects: Henry VII; occasional verse; York; historical verse
_description: Address of Welcome to Henry VII at York (1486), presentation of the Keys of the City — four stanzas rhyme royal

YorkCity6.First Lines:
Most Reuerend rightwose regent of this RigalitieWhos primatiue
                    patrone I peyre to your presence…
YorkCity6.Last Lines:
…Gladdith and Inioith your high grace and commyngWith our
                    concent knowing you þus sufferaine and king
YorkCity6.Editions:

BLCottJulBXII.First Lines:
O Reuerdende Rightwis Regent of this RegalitieWhos
                    primatyve patron I apper to your presence…
BLCottJulBXII.Last Lines:
…Gladdeth & enoyneth your highnesse and commyngWith hole
                    consente knowing you ther souueraigne & king
BLCottJulBXII.Note:
‘Ebraucus’ written in the left margin (f. 10v).
                    Folio number reflects the most recent foliation.
